etymology.description: semantic 犭(犭) (quǎn, "dog") + phonetic 侯(侯) (hóu, "marquis") = animal phoneticized by 侯 -> monkey
etymology.interpretation: 猴(猴) (hóu, "monkey") combines 犭(犭) (quǎn, "dog") as a radical indicating an animal, with 侯(侯) (hóu, "marquis") as a phonetic element that provides the sound. This forms the character for monkey by linking the concept of an animal with the sound similar to '侯'.

examples.chinese: 一只猴爬上高高的树(一隻猴爬上高高的樹)。
examples.pinyin: Yī zhī hóu pá shàng gāogāo de shù.
examples.english: A monkey climbs up the tall tree.

examples.chinese: 猴在森林中跳跃(猴在森林中跳躍)，寻找美味的果子(尋找美味的果子)。
examples.pinyin: Hóu zài sēnlín zhōng tiàoyuè, xúnzhǎo měiwèi de guǒzi.
examples.english: The monkey leaps in the forest, searching for delicious fruits.
